channel.title: [PI]Ticks
channel.description: Somebody explain the tick system to me please

item.title: [PI]Ticks
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:4, topic:428691”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=531384.msg3882790#msg3882790 date=1326168256]

Somebody explain the tick system to me please

Ticks are essentially when something happens (kind of like frequency). So since the server usually “ticks” at 600ms, then it completes one cycle in 600ms, making the frequency 1.6Hz
[/quote]how long does 1.6hz last? what would be an example of something running on a tick? pros and cons of usings ticks over events?[/quote]

A tick is one period. It’s not an entity. So if you’re computer is running at 2.8GHz, then it’s ticking (or completing on cycle) in one second. In that one second, 2.8 billion instructions are being processed. The period of most servers is 600ms., so it’s ticking every 600ms.

The best analogy is a clock. It literally ticks every second.

Read full topic
